name: Remanent Data Readable after Memory Erase
description: Confidential information stored in memory circuits is readable or recoverable after being cleared or erased.

x_mitre_content_history.submission_name: Hareesh Khattri, Arun Kanuparthi, Parbati K. Manna

x_mitre_detection_methods.method: Dynamic Analysis with Manual Results Interpretation

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: Firmware Data Deletion Vulnerability in which a base station factory reset might not delete all user information. The impact of this enables a new owner of a used device that has been "factory-default reset" with a vulnerable firmware version can still retrieve, at least, the previous owner's wireless network name, and the previous owner's wireless security (such as WPA2) key. This issue was addressed with improved, data deletion.
